# Overview

Naming conventions in Photo Metadata Editor allow you to automatically rename files using dynamic patterns called **tokens**. Tokens are placeholders that get replaced with actual metadata values from your photos.

For example, the pattern:
```
{userid}_{date}_{original_name}
```

Could become:
```
MGledhill_2025-12-08_IMG_1234.jpg
```

---

# Quick Reference Table

| Token Syntax | Description |
|---|---|
| `{date}` | Current date in YYYY-MM-DD format |
| `{datetime:%FORMAT%}` | Custom formatted date/time |
| `{title}` | Photo title from metadata |
| `{description}` | Photo description from metadata |
| `{creator}` | Creator/artist name from metadata |
| `{camera_model}` | Camera model used |
| `{lens_model}` | Lens model used |
| `{sequence:N}` | Sequential numbering with padding |
| `{original_name}` | Original filename without extension |
| `{userid}` | Custom user identifier |
| `{copyright}` | Copyright information |
| `{rating}` | Photo rating (0-5 stars) |

---

# Detailed Token Reference

## Date and Time Tokens

### `{date}`

**What it does:** Inserts the current date in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD).

**Output format:** `2025-12-08`

**Use case:** When you want a standardized date format that sorts correctly.

**Example pattern:**
```
{date}_{original_name}
```

**Example output:**
```
2025-12-08_vacation_photo.jpg
```

---

### `{datetime:%FORMAT%}`

**What it does:** Inserts a custom formatted date/time using Python's strftime format codes.

**Format codes:**
- `%Y` - 4-digit year (2025)
- `%y` - 2-digit year (25)
- `%m` - 2-digit month (01-12)
- `%d` - 2-digit day (01-31)
- `%H` - 24-hour format hour (00-23)
- `%I` - 12-hour format hour (01-12)
- `%M` - Minutes (00-59)
- `%S` - Seconds (00-59)
- `%p` - AM/PM
- `%b` - Abbreviated month name (Jan, Feb, etc.)
- `%B` - Full month name (January, February, etc.)
- `%A` - Full weekday name (Monday, Tuesday, etc.)

**Use case:** When you need a specific date/time format for your workflow.

**Example patterns:**

Simple date and time:
```
{datetime:%Y%m%d_%H%M%S}_{original_name}
```
Output: `20251208_143025_photo.jpg`

Human-readable format:
```
{datetime:%Y-%m-%d_%I.%M%p}_{original_name}
```
Output: `2025-12-08_02.30PM_photo.jpg`

Month and year folder structure:
```
{datetime:%Y/%B}/{original_name}
```
Output: `2025/December/photo.jpg`

Compact timestamp:
```
{datetime:%y%m%d%H%M}_{original_name}
```
Output: `251208143025_photo.jpg`

---

## Metadata Tokens

### `{title}`

**What it does:** Inserts the photo title from EXIF `ImageDescription` or XMP `dc:title`.

**Output format:** Text string, spaces preserved

**Use case:** When photos have descriptive titles you want in the filename.

**Example pattern:**
```
{date}_{title}
```

**Example output:**
```
2025-12-08_Sunset_at_Beach.jpg
```

**Notes:**
- Returns empty string if no title exists
- Special characters (/, \, :, etc.) are removed or replaced
- Spaces are preserved by default

---

### `{description}`

**What it does:** Inserts the photo description from XMP `dc:description`.

**Output format:** Text string, truncated if too long

**Use case:** When you want a brief description in the filename.

**Example pattern:**
```
{userid}_{description}_{sequence:03d}
```

**Example output:**
```
MGledhill_Family_Reunion_001.jpg
```

**Notes:**
- Automatically truncated to reasonable length for filenames
- Useful for photo series with descriptions

---

### `{creator}`

**What it does:** Inserts the photographer/artist name from EXIF `Artist` or XMP `dc:creator`.

**Output format:** Text string

**Use case:** When organizing photos by photographer in multi-photographer projects.

**Example pattern:**
```
{creator}_{date}_{original_name}
```

**Example output:**
```
John_Doe_2025-12-08_portrait.jpg
```

---

### `{copyright}`

**What it does:** Inserts copyright information from EXIF `Copyright` or XMP `dc:rights`.

**Output format:** Text string

**Use case:** When embedding copyright owner in filename for rights management.

**Example pattern:**
```
{date}_{title}_©{copyright}
```

**Example output:**
```
2025-12-08_Wedding_Shot_©Smith_Photography.jpg
```

---

### `{rating}`

**What it does:** Inserts the photo rating from XMP `xmp:Rating` (typically 0-5 stars).

**Output format:** Single digit number

**Use case:** When organizing photos by rating/quality.

**Example pattern:**
```
{rating}star_{date}_{original_name}
```

**Example output:**
```
5star_2025-12-08_best_shot.jpg
```

---

## Camera Information Tokens

### `{camera_model}`

**What it does:** Inserts the camera model from EXIF `Model` tag.

**Output format:** Text string (manufacturer name often included)

**Use case:** When organizing photos by camera body, especially useful for photographers with multiple cameras.

**Example pattern:**
```
{camera_model}_{date}_{sequence:04d}
```

**Example output:**
```
Canon_EOS_R5_2025-12-08_0001.jpg
```

**Notes:**
- Usually includes manufacturer name (Canon EOS R5, Nikon Z9, etc.)
- Spaces and special characters are preserved

---

### `{lens_model}`

**What it does:** Inserts the lens model from EXIF `LensModel` tag.

**Output format:** Text string

**Use case:** When testing different lenses or organizing by focal length/lens type.

**Example pattern:**
```
{date}_{lens_model}_{original_name}
```

**Example output:**
```
2025-12-08_RF24-70mm_F2.8_L_IS_USM_test_shot.jpg
```

**Notes:**
- Includes full lens designation
- Useful for lens comparison projects

---

## Sequential and File Tokens

### `{sequence:N}`

**What it does:** Inserts an automatically incrementing number with zero-padding.

**Format:** `{sequence:NNd}` where NN is the number of digits

**Common formats:**
- `{sequence:01d}` - Single digit: 1, 2, 3...
- `{sequence:02d}` - Two digits: 01, 02, 03...
- `{sequence:03d}` - Three digits: 001, 002, 003...
- `{sequence:04d}` - Four digits: 0001, 0002, 0003...

**Use case:** Creating numbered sequences of photos that sort correctly.

**Example patterns:**

Standard 3-digit sequence:
```
{userid}_{date}_{sequence:03d}
```
Output: `MGledhill_2025-12-08_001.jpg`

4-digit sequence for large batches:
```
{datetime:%Y%m%d}_{sequence:04d}
```
Output: `20251208_0001.jpg`

Named sequence:
```
{title}_img{sequence:02d}
```
Output: `Wedding_Reception_img01.jpg`

**Notes:**
- Counter resets for each batch operation
- Zero-padding ensures proper alphabetical sorting
- More digits = supports larger batches

---

### `{original_name}`

**What it does:** Inserts the original filename without the file extension.

**Output format:** Text string

**Use case:** When you want to preserve part of the original filename while adding metadata.

**Example pattern:**
```
{date}_{original_name}
```

**Example output:**
```
2025-12-08_IMG_1234.jpg
```

**Notes:**
- Extension is NOT included (added automatically)
- Preserves original camera-generated names
- Useful when combining with other tokens

---

### `{userid}`

**What it does:** Inserts a custom user identifier that you can set in the application.

**Output format:** Text string (you define it)

**Use case:** Adding your initials, company name, or project code to all files.

**Example pattern:**
```
{userid}_{datetime:%Y%m%d}_{sequence:03d}
```

**Example output:**
```
MGledhill_20251208_001.jpg
```

**Notes:**
- You set this value once in the app settings
- Great for personal branding
- Ideal for multi-user workflows

---

# Pattern Examples by Use Case

## Personal Photography

**Simple date-based:**
```
{date}_{original_name}
→ 2025-12-08_IMG_1234.jpg
```

**Date with sequence:**
```
{datetime:%Y-%m-%d}_{sequence:03d}
→ 2025-12-08_001.jpg
```

**Personal branding:**
```
{userid}_{date}_{title}
→ JDoe_2025-12-08_Mountain_Sunrise.jpg
```

---

## Professional Photography

**Client + date + sequence:**
```
{userid}_Client_{date}_{sequence:04d}
→ SmithPhoto_Client_2025-12-08_0001.jpg
```

**Event photography:**
```
{title}_{datetime:%Y%m%d}_{sequence:03d}
→ Johnson_Wedding_20251208_001.jpg
```

**Timestamped deliverables:**
```
{datetime:%Y%m%d_%H%M%S}_{original_name}
→ 20251208_143025_portrait.jpg
```

---

## Archive and Organization

**Year/Month structure:**
```
{datetime:%Y}/{datetime:%m}_{date}_{original_name}
→ 2025/12_2025-12-08_vacation.jpg
```

**Camera-based organization:**
```
{camera_model}/{date}_{sequence:04d}
→ Canon_EOS_R5/2025-12-08_0001.jpg
```

**Rating-based:**
```
Rating{rating}/{date}_{title}
→ Rating5/2025-12-08_Best_Shot.jpg
```

---

## Technical/Test Shots

**Lens testing:**
```
{date}_{lens_model}_{sequence:02d}
→ 2025-12-08_RF24-70mm_F2.8_01.jpg
```

**Camera comparison:**
```
{camera_model}_{datetime:%H%M%S}
→ Sony_A7IV_143025.jpg
```

**Detailed timestamp:**
```
{datetime:%Y%m%d_%H%M%S}_{camera_model}
→ 20251208_143025_Nikon_Z9.jpg
```

# Tips and Best Practices

## 1. Use Zero-Padding for Sequences

**Good:**
```
{sequence:03d}  →  001, 002, ..., 099, 100
```

**Bad:**
```
{sequence:01d}  →  1, 2, ..., 9, 10 (sorts incorrectly)
```

## 2. Date Formats for Sorting

For chronological sorting, use:
```
{datetime:%Y%m%d}  →  20251208
```

Not:
```
{datetime:%m-%d-%Y}  →  12-08-2025 (sorts incorrectly)
```

## 3. Avoid Special Characters

Avoid these in patterns: `/ \ : * ? " < > |`

Use underscores or hyphens instead:
```
{userid}_{date}  ✓
{userid}/{date}  ✗ (creates subfolder)
```

## 4. Keep Filenames Reasonable Length

Aim for under 60 characters total:
```
{datetime:%Y%m%d}_{sequence:03d}  ✓ (short)
{datetime:%Y-%m-%d_%H:%M:%S}_{title}_{description}_{creator}  ✗ (too long)
```

## 5. Test Before Batch Processing

Always test your naming convention on a few files first:
- Use "Dry Run" mode
- Check the preview
- Verify sorting works as expected

# Common Patterns Cheat Sheet

```
# Minimal
{date}_{sequence:03d}

# Standard
{userid}_{date}_{original_name}

# Timestamped
{datetime:%Y%m%d_%H%M%S}_{sequence:03d}

# Descriptive
{date}_{title}_{sequence:02d}

# Professional
{userid}_{title}_{datetime:%Y%m%d}_{sequence:04d}

# Archive
{datetime:%Y/%B/%d}_{original_name}

# Technical
{camera_model}_{lens_model}_{datetime:%Y%m%d_%H%M%S}
```

# Troubleshooting

## Token Not Replacing

**Problem:** Token appears literally in filename (e.g., `{date}_photo.jpg`)

**Solutions:**
- Check spelling and formatting
- Ensure curly braces are used: `{token}` not `(token)` or `[token]`
- Verify token is supported (see reference table)

## Empty Token Values

**Problem:** Token gets replaced with nothing (e.g., `_photo.jpg` instead of `title_photo.jpg`)

**Solutions:**
- Check if metadata exists in the photo (use "View Metadata")
- Add fallback text or use `{original_name}` as backup
- Ensure metadata template was applied first

## Invalid Filename Errors

**Problem:** Files won't rename due to invalid characters

**Solutions:**
- Remove special characters: `/ \ : * ? " < > |`
- Check datetime format doesn't include colons
- Verify pattern doesn't create duplicate names

## Files Not Sorting Correctly

**Problem:** Files sort in wrong order (e.g., 1, 10, 2, 20...)

**Solutions:**
- Use zero-padding: `{sequence:03d}` instead of `{sequence:01d}`
- Use YYYYMMDD date format for chronological sorting
- Test sort order before applying to entire batch

---

# Advanced Techniques

## Combining Multiple Tokens

You can combine any tokens to create complex patterns:

```
{userid}_{camera_model}_{datetime:%Y%m%d}_{title}_{sequence:04d}
```

## Conditional Patterns

While not directly supported, you can create different naming conventions for different scenarios:

**Portrait Convention:**
```
Portrait_{creator}_{date}_{sequence:03d}
```

**Landscape Convention:**
```
Landscape_{location}_{datetime:%Y%m%d_%H%M}
```

## Organizing Into Folders

Use the datetime token with `/` to create folder structures:

```
{datetime:%Y/%B}/{date}_{sequence:03d}
→ 2025/December/2025-12-08_001.jpg
```

This creates year/month folders automatically!
